intro: Peltogyne micrantha, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by pod-like fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its valuable timber, it is also listed as a vulnerable species in some regions.
